revised_title: Molecular Chaperones: Functions of hsp60 and TF55-TCP1 Families in Protein Folding
tldr: The article discusses the functions of two families of molecular chaperones, hsp60 and TF55-TCP1, in protein folding within the cell. hsp60 plays a global role in polypeptide chain folding in mitochondria, while the TF55-TCP1 family has a similar function in other cellular compartments. Both families are essential for maintaining proper protein folding and function in the cell.
